category/children.description: Gets the child categories for a specified parent category.

realtime_start.description: The start of the real-time period.

realtime_end.description: The end of the real-time period.

category/related.description: Get the related categories for a category. A related category is a one-way relation between 2 categories that is not part of a parent-child category hierarchy. Most categories do not have related categories

realtime_start.description: The start of the real-time period.

realtime_end.description: The end of the real-time period.

category/series.description: Get the series in a category.

realtime_start.description: The start of the real-time period.

realtime_end.description: The end of the real-time period.

limit.description: The maximum number of results to return
limit.restrictions: Must be an integer between 1 and 1000

order_by.description: Order results by values of the specified attribute.

sort_order.description: Sort results is ascending or descending order for attribute values specified by order_by.

filter_variable.description: The attribute to filter results by.

filter_value.description: The value of the filter_variable attribute to filter results by.

tag_names.description: A semicolon delimited list of tag names that series match all of.

exclude_tag_names.description: A semicolon delimited list of tag names that series match none of.
exclude_tag_names.restrictions: Parameter exclude_tag_names requires that parameter tag_names also be set to limit the number of matching series.

category/tags.description: Get the related FRED tags for one or more FRED tags within a category. Optionally, filter results by tag group or search. FRED tags are attributes assigned to series. For this request, related FRED tags are the tags assigned to series that match all tags in the tag_names parameter, no tags in the exclude_tag_names parameter, and the category set by the category_id parameter. See the related request fred/category/tags. Series are assigned tags and categories. Indirectly through series, it is possible to get the tags for a category. No tags exist for a category that does not have series.

realtime_start.description: The start of the real-time period.

realtime_end.description: The end of the real-time period.

limit.description: The maximum number of results to return
limit.restrictions: Must be an integer between 1 and 1000

order_by.description: Order results by values of the specified attribute.

sort_order.description: Sort results is ascending or descending order for attribute values specified by order_by.

tag_names.description: A semicolon delimited list of tag names that series match all of.

tag_group_id.description: A tag group id to filter tags by type.

search_text.description: The words to find matching tags with.

category/related_tags.description: Get the related categories for a category. A related category is a one-way relation between 2 categories that is not part of a parent-child category hierarchy. Most categories do not have related categories

releases/dates.description: Get release dates for all releases of economic data.

realtime_start.description: The start of the real-time period.

realtime_end.description: The end of the real-time period.

limit.description: The maximum number of results to return
limit.restrictions: Must be an integer between 1 and 1000

order_by.description: Order results by values of the specified attribute.

sort_order.description: Sort results is ascending or descending order for attribute values specified by order_by.

include_release_dates_with_no_data.description: Determines whether release dates with no data available are returned. The defalut value 'false' excludes release dates that do not have data. In particular, this excludes future release dates which may be available in the FRED release calendar or the ALFRED release calendar.

release.description: Get a release of economic data.

realtime_start.description: The start of the real-time period.

realtime_end.description: The end of the real-time period.

release/dates.description: Get release dates for a release of economic data.

realtime_end.description: The end of the real-time period.

limit.restrictions: Must be an integer between 1 and 10000

sort_order.description: Sort results is ascending or descending release date order.

include_release_dates_with_no_data.description: Determines whether release dates with no data available are returned. The defalut value 'false' excludes release dates that do not have data. In particular, this excludes future release dates which may be available in the FRED release calendar or the ALFRED release calendar.

limit.description: The maximum number of results to return

order_by.description: Order results by values of the specified attribute.

release/tables.description: Get release table trees for a given release. You can go directly to the tree structure by passing the appropriate element_id. You may also use a drill-down approach to start at the root (top most) element by leaving the element_id off.

element_id.description: The release table element id you would like to retrieve.
element_id.restrictions: When the parameter is not passed, the root(top most) element for the release is given.

include_observation_values.description: A flag to indicate that observations need to be returned. Observation value and date will only be returned for a series type element.

observation_date.description: The observation date to be included with the returned release table.

realtime_start.description: The start of the real-time period.

realtime_end.description: The end of the real-time period.

series/categories.description: Get the categories for an economic data series.

realtime_start.description: The start of the real-time period.

realtime_end.description: The end of the real-time period.

series/observations.description: Get the observations or data values for an economic data series.

realtime_start.description: The start of the real-time period.

realtime_end.description: The end of the real-time period.

limit.description: The maximum number of results to return
limit.restrictions: Must be an integer between 1 and 100000

sort_order.description: Sort results is ascending or descending order for attribute values specified by order_by.

observation_start.description: The start of the observation period.

observation_end.description: The end of the observation period.

units.description: A key that indicates a data value transformation.

frequency.description: An optional parameter that indicates a lower frequency to aggregate values to. The FRED frequency aggregation feature converts higher frequency data series into lower frequency data series (e.g. converts a monthly data series into an annual data series). In FRED, the highest frequency data is daily, and the lowest frequency data is annual. There are 3 aggregation methods available- average, sum, and end of period. See https://research.stlouisfed.org/docs/api/fred/series_observations.html for more information

aggregation_method.description: A key that indicates the aggregation method used for frequency aggregation. This parameter has no affect if the frequency parameter is not set.

output_type.description: An integer that indicates an output type. See https://research.stlouisfed.org/docs/api/fred/series_observations.html#output_type for more information

vintage_dates.description: A comma separated string of YYYY-MM-DD formatted dates in history (e.g. 2000-01-01,2005-02-24). Vintage dates are used to download data as it existed on these specified dates in history. Vintage dates can be specified instead of a real-time period using realtime_start and realtime_end.

series/release.description: Get the release for an economic data series.

realtime_start.description: The start of the real-time period.

realtime_end.description: The end of the real-time period.

series/search.description: Get economic data series that match search text.

realtime_start.description: The start of the real-time period.

realtime_end.description: The end of the real-time period.

limit.description: The maximum number of results to return
limit.restrictions: Must be an integer between 1 and 1000

order_by.default: If the value of search_type is 'full_text' then the default value of order_by is 'search_rank'. If the value of search_type is 'series_id' then the default value of order_by is 'series_id'.
order_by.description: Order results by values of the specified attribute.

sort_order.description: Sort results is ascending or descending order for attribute values specified by order_by.

filter_variable.description: The attribute to filter results by.

filter_value.description: The value of the filter_variable attribute to filter results by.

tag_names.description: A semicolon delimited list of tag names that series match all of.

exclude_tag_names.description: A semicolon delimited list of tag names that series match none of.
exclude_tag_names.restrictions: Parameter exclude_tag_names requires that parameter tag_names also be set to limit the number of matching series.

search_text.description: The words to find matching tags with.

search_type.description: Determines the type of search to perform.
search_type.restrictions: One of the following strings: 'full_text', 'series_id'. For more information, see https://research.stlouisfed.org/docs/api/fred/series_search.html#search_type

series/search/tags.description: Get the FRED tags for a series search. Optionally, filter results by tag name, tag group, or tag search.

tag_group_id.description: A tag group id to filter tags by type.

series/updates.description: Get economic data series sorted by when observations were updated on the FRED server (attribute last_updated). Results are limited to series updated within the last two weeks.

realtime_start.description: The start of the real-time period.

realtime_end.description: The end of the real-time period.

limit.description: The maximum number of results to return
limit.restrictions: Must be an integer between 1 and 1000

filter_value.description: Limit results by geographic type of economic data series; namely 'macro', 'regional', and 'all'.
filter_value.restrictions: 'macro' limits results to macroeconomic data series. In general, these are series for entire countries that are not subregions of the United States. 'regional' limits results to series for parts of the US; namely, series for US states, counties, and Metropolitan Statistical Areas (MSA). 'all' does not filter results.

series/vintagedates.description: Get the dates in history when a series' data values were revised or new data values were released. Vintage dates are the release dates for a series excluding release dates when the data for the series did not change.

realtime_end.description: The end of the real-time period.

limit.description: The maximum number of results to return

sort_order.description: Sort results is ascending or descending order for attribute values specified by order_by.
